section.content: One Path Sales Development Training January 2016 One Path Sales Development Training January 2016

section.title: Table of Contents
section.content: Table of Contents 1 Program Overview 2 3 What is In Scope and what is not Eclipse Changes (Factory & Stock) 4 Dart, iComp, & iDev Changes 5 Price Parity Table of Contents 1 Program Overview 2 3 What is In Scope and what is not Eclipse Changes (Factory & Stock) 4 Dart, iComp, & iDev Changes 5 Price Parity
section.related-content:
Thank you for taking the time to join our training again. Welcome to One Path 101. The purpose of this session is to train our team on processes that will impact our day to day. While the program is designed to simplify the partner experience it has now expanded if you will the operational process.
Today we will cover an overview of the program, what is in and out of scope, eclipse, dart, icomp, and idev changes, and price parity.
In this training it kind of builds to where you get foundation first. Applied next and live last. We are going to build up regarding the information from foundation to live.

section.title: One Path Terms
section.content: One Path Terms One Path Terms
section.related-content:
So lets jump right in: Hopefully each of you joined Brook’s training on Friday and have listened to both the 2 minute snippet and the 12 minute training webinars that have been provided to introduce the program.
This should be a somewhat familiar slide to you….you have seen it before
“Today’s terms” and “Tomorrow’s terms”.
For the business model Today, Value Indirect, to tomorrow’s term: Channel Factory ( this is for CTO and Enterprise product or shipped from Factory)
For the business model Today, Indirect/Partner Direct (aka Volume Indirect) , to tomorrow’s term: Channel Stock (this is primarily for BTO or commercial product or ship from Stock)
For Benefits, we move from SSR and NBO to Solution and Segment for these 2 benefits which will still remain upfront the partner with the benefits will have the pricing advantage and will be referred to as the Lead partners and all others will be the non-lead. I will break down the benefit qualifiers a little later in the training.
DMI – Distribution Margin Incentive and is backend compensation for the distributor

section.title: What are the One Path key improvements…
section.content: What are the One Path key improvements… HPE establishes end-user pricing and sets channel margin for some opportunities HPE registration required to obtain pricing for Value resulting in time delays Many complex overlapping frontend programs caused by Volume and Value choice point Unified path with few frontend programs that are simplified and have harmonized Ts&Cs HPE prices to distribution for all programs enabling partner controlled margin Availability of instant market ready pre-approved pricing across EG product set with no HPE touch Protected Pricing in value motion is questionable producing conflict due to fragmented pricing engines Benefit protection model secures level of margin to consistently provide advantage to invested partner Price to Win Confidential: Restricted for HPE and Channel Partner internal use only FROM: “Complex, Confusing, Un-Friendly…too hard to sell HPE” TO: “Simple, Clear, Consistent…easier to sell HPE” What are the One Path key improvements… HPE establishes end-user pricing and sets channel margin for some opportunities HPE registration required to obtain pricing for Value resulting in time delays Many complex overlapping frontend programs caused by Volume and Value choice point Unified path with few frontend programs that are simplified and have harmonized Ts&Cs HPE prices to distribution for all programs enabling partner controlled margin Availability of instant market ready pre-approved pricing across EG product set with no HPE touch Protected Pricing in value motion is questionable producing conflict due to fragmented pricing engines Benefit protection model secures level of margin to consistently provide advantage to invested partner Price to Win Confidential: Restricted for HPE and Channel Partner internal use only FROM: “Complex, Confusing, Un-Friendly…too hard to sell HPE” TO: “Simple, Clear, Consistent…easier to sell HPE”
section.related-content:
Key changes or improvements for partners from a BD perspective with the One Path introduction: 1) we are changing our terminology with 2 new RTM business models (Value/Volume will be replaced with Channel Factory/Channel Stock) models. 2) Both models will be priced to distribution now allowing the partners to control their margin. 3) Price protection will now be defined by the partner with benefits and not BD special pricing and that partner will now be known as the LEAD partner.
For Channel Stock deals the benefits applied provides the pricing differentiation. For Channel Factory the benefits again will provide the protection because multiple BDs will now be allowed per opportunity.

section.title: What is the One Path pricing ladder…
section.content: Escalated Big Deal* % varies by opportunity What is the One Path pricing ladder… Pre-Approved Pricing No Touch Negotiated Pricing High Touch Smart Buy % varies by product Discount Now 20% to 65% Instant everyday price Great price on specific configurations or bundles Aggressive discount for strategic opportunities Engagement Model Program Description Registration Benefits Low Touch Solution Exclusive incentive to ONE partner for selling richer value-add HPE configurations HPE Registration Segment 3% 7% - 17% Platinum 5% - 15% Silver/Gold Exclusive incentive to ONE partner for selling into HPE Commercial 2, SMB and SLED/Federal markets Discount *Benefits become a function of price when pricing is escalated. No-Touch Low-Touch Escalated Pricing HPE Confidential: Restricted for HPE and Channel Partner internal use only Escalated Big Deal* % varies by opportunity What is the One Path pricing ladder… Pre-Approved Pricing No Touch Negotiated Pricing High Touch Smart Buy % varies by product Discount Now 20% to 65% Instant everyday price Great price on specific configurations or bundles Aggressive discount for strategic opportunities Engagement Model Program Description Registration Benefits Low Touch Solution Exclusive incentive to ONE partner for selling richer value-add HPE configurations HPE Registration Segment 3% 7% - 17% Platinum 5% - 15% Silver/Gold Exclusive incentive to ONE partner for selling into HPE Commercial 2, SMB and SLED/Federal markets Discount *Benefits become a function of price when pricing is escalated. No-Touch Low-Touch Escalated Pricing HPE Confidential: Restricted for HPE and Channel Partner internal use only
section.related-content:
Let’s take a minute to review the One Path Pricing Ladder. There are 3 components to the engagement model...No Touch, Low Touch, and High Touch. No Touch is available directly to the channel where there is no HPE involvement which includes Discount Now and Smart buy pricing. Low Touch pricing comes into play when the partner wants to come in and register for benefits once approved they apply their benefits to their no touch pricing which again is Discount Now and Smart Buy. High Touch the partner still needs more aggressive pricing so they come back and request "Escalated Pricing“ meaning special pricing in our world today.
Discount Now pricing stacked with Solution and Segment benefits is designed to equate to VEP Tier 4 pricing. There are 3 options for Discount Now which is based on the segment…so there will be a FED DN, SLED DN, and then all others.
In One Path, a partner can register for benefits and request special pricing at the same time. It is no longer a serial process.

section.title: Partner Benefits - Upfront
section.content: Partner Benefits - Upfront Internal Use Only Solution: Compensates and rewards a single partner for selling an HPE BTO or CTO solution (Partner must be HPE EG Silver, Gold, or Platinum Specialist, Partner must demonstrate value-add activity documented in Deal Registration Tool, Requires attach of uplifted Support Services) Based on List for Discount Now Pricing Based on Net for Special PricingSegment: Compensates and rewards a single partner for selling into HPE’s Commercial 2 and below account space and government (Segment has no look back conditions, as it is unrelated to historical sales) Based on List for Discount Now Pricing Based on Net for Special Pricing DART has been updated to capture benefits differences between Platinum and Non-Platinum partners Segment benefit has no differentiation Partner Benefits - Upfront Internal Use Only Solution: Compensates and rewards a single partner for selling an HPE BTO or CTO solution (Partner must be HPE EG Silver, Gold, or Platinum Specialist, Partner must demonstrate value-add activity documented in Deal Registration Tool, Requires attach of uplifted Support Services) Based on List for Discount Now Pricing Based on Net for Special PricingSegment: Compensates and rewards a single partner for selling into HPE’s Commercial 2 and below account space and government (Segment has no look back conditions, as it is unrelated to historical sales) Based on List for Discount Now Pricing Based on Net for Special Pricing DART has been updated to capture benefits differences between Platinum and Non-Platinum partners Segment benefit has no differentiation
section.related-content:
In the earlier slide I mentioned some new terms or benefits for One Path and I want to break down the definition of those:
. I will start with Segment because it only has 1 requirement which is a kicker to incent the partners to sell into our Commercial 2, SMB, and SLED/FED accounts they will be eligible for this benefit. Solution Benefit has 3 requirements 1) the partner must be a medal partner….silver, gold, or platinum. 2) partner has to provide documented levels of pre-sales value add activity. 3) TS attach: we will now require 1:1 TS support be sold with the HW meaning if you are selling 50 servers they have to attach 1 uplifted service for each server.
Both Benefits are exclusive to one partner per opportunity.
Solution and Segment benefit amounts move from % of list to % of net when they go from using Discount Now pricing to BD Special pricing.

section.title: Distributor Margin Incentive (DMI) - Backend
section.content:
Distributor Margin Incentive (DMI) - Backend
 DMI = Distributor Margin Incentive Internal Use Only Non-Negotiable Automatically paid to distribution when using the New Channel Factory (up-front) and Channel Stock (Back-end) business models Factoring DMI in the Financials BDM’s only factor DMI when composing financials for pricing escalations to the BU’s DMI will be treated as a new backend comp In addition to our current backend comp DMI should not be pro-actively discussed with Sales Distributor Margin Incentive (DMI) - Backend
 DMI = Distributor Margin Incentive Internal Use Only Non-Negotiable Automatically paid to distribution when using the New Channel Factory (up-front) and Channel Stock (Back-end) business models Factoring DMI in the Financials BDM’s only factor DMI when composing financials for pricing escalations to the BU’s DMI will be treated as a new backend comp In addition to our current backend comp DMI should not be pro-actively discussed with Sales
section.related-content:
What I previously reviewed were the up front benefits that the partner receives for being the lead partner. There is an additional distribution benefit applicable with One Path, DMI (Distributor Margin Incentive). We will factor it into deal financials when we escalate to finance for pricing approval. DMI is not to be discussed with resellers. And it's non-negotiable.
These amounts range from .5 – 3% of net depending on the PL. If you want to know how much each PL pulls then those percentages can be found in the playground of the iComp.
Quick recap – frontend benefits are for the reseller and backend is to the distributor.

section.title: How does Value pricing change?
section.content: How does Value pricing change? Value Express Pricing Discount Now Solution Benefit Value Big Deal Pre Post Value NBO Segment Benefit Segment Benefit Value NBO Solution Benefit 1st Price Response Escalated Pricing Highlights No-Touch Low-Touch Escalated Pricing Escalated Pricing VEP and NBO are decommissioned “Express” pricing is through Discount Now provided by distribution without HPE registration Discount Now is combinable with benefits. When combined, benefits are a percent of List Price Benefits are exclusive to ONE partner Benefits require HPE registration and are incremental discount by PL Solution benefit is opportunity based reward for selling richer value-add configurations; Requires TS attach Segment benefit is opportunity based reward for selling into HPE commercial 2 accounts (C2, SMB, SLED) and Federal accounts No $min and no deal size tiers for Discount Now or benefits Escalated pricing is special negotiated big deal combinable with benefits. When combined, benefits are a factor of the escalated big deal net Escalated big deal is primarily bundle CTO priced to distribution. Reseller sets customer price (cap set by HPE is eliminated). One reseller and one distributor named per big deal. $75K list min deal size ($25K min HPN only). Pricing is non-exclusive Enterprise solutions must be priced and ordered through reseller’s select tiered distributor Confidential: Restricted for HPE and Channel Partner internal use only How does Value pricing change? Value Express Pricing Discount Now Solution Benefit Value Big Deal Pre Post Value NBO Segment Benefit Segment Benefit Value NBO Solution Benefit 1st Price Response Escalated Pricing Highlights No-Touch Low-Touch Escalated Pricing Escalated Pricing VEP and NBO are decommissioned “Express” pricing is through Discount Now provided by distribution without HPE registration Discount Now is combinable with benefits. When combined, benefits are a factor of the escalated big deal net Escalated big deal is primarily bundle CTO priced to distribution. Reseller sets customer price (cap set by HPE is eliminated). One reseller and one distributor named per big deal. $75K list min deal size ($25K min HPN only). Pricing is non-exclusive Enterprise solutions must be priced and ordered through reseller’s select tiered distributor Confidential: Restricted for HPE and Channel Partner internal use only
section.related-content:
How does Value pricing change? Well today current state 1st response pricing is VEP plus NBO. Future state will be discount now with solution and segment benefit.
Current state for Escalated pricing is a value big deal plus NBO and future state will be special pricing with solution and segment benefit.
To call out a few highlights
Value Indirect will now be called Channel Factory
There can be multiple deals for the same opportunity meaning 1 deal for the Lead partner and 1 or more non-lead partner deals.
Minimum deal size is $75K list ($25K for HPN).
Pricing is to distribution as we no longer set the end user price.

section.related-content:
How does Volume pricing change? Well today current state 1st response pricing is Discount Now plus NBO&SSR. Future state will be Discount Now with solution and segment benefit.
Current state for Escalated pricing is a volume big deal plus NBO and SSR and future state will be special pricing or escalated pricing with solution and segment benefit.
Key highlights for volume changes:
Volume Indirect will now be called Channel Stock.
Minimum deal size is $75K list ($25K for HPN).
The pricing advantage will be to the partner that holds the benefits for that opportunity.

section.related-content: Here is what we are considering Out of Scope for One Path: so PIPP, CSATs, OEM and Market Place deals, Global Outbound just to call out a few will continue to use the existing Value Indirect/Volume Indirect Eclipse models. Pam will now go into detail on the changes for global.

section.title: What’s changing for Global?
section.content: What’s changing for Global? Global Outbound: US is the Lead Country, establishing pricing for a Global customer purchasing in other countries Pricing avail outside US SmartQuote Global Indirect Big Deal, no approved reg benefits Global Inbound: Lead Country (outside of the US) establishing pricing for a Global customer purchasing in the US Pricing matches incoming country One Path Stock or Factory Big Deal, no approved reg benefits Regional pricing Deal Registration One Path Stock or Factory Big Deal, Reg benefits eligible US Regional Deal for a Global Account Regional pricing stays within US Scenario Request Tool Business Model Global Outbound Pricing is out of scope for One Path (i.e. no Solution or Segment benefits) Global Inbound Pricing is out of scope for One Path benefits, however, we will use the new Channel Factory & Channel Stock Business models. Reducing complexity in our replication process, aligning to lead country pricing to distribution and supports bundles for Enterprise product, using Channel Factory model Finance has approved and HPE will pay DMI on One Path Business models for Global Inbound deals US Regional Deals for a Global Account are in scope for One Path (Benefits + new Channel Stock/Channel Factory business models What’s changing for Global? Global Outbound: US is the Lead Country, establishing pricing for a Global customer purchasing in other countries Pricing avail outside US SmartQuote Global Indirect Big Deal, no approved reg benefits Global Inbound: Lead Country (outside of the US) establishing pricing for a Global customer purchasing in the US Pricing matches incoming country One Path Stock or Factory Big Deal, no approved reg benefits Regional pricing Deal Registration One Path Stock or Factory Big Deal, Reg benefits eligible US Regional Deal for a Global Account Regional pricing stays within US Scenario Request Tool Business Model Global Outbound Pricing is out of scope for One Path (i.e. no Solution or Segment benefits) Global Inbound Pricing is out of scope for One Path benefits, however, we will use the new Channel Factory & Channel Stock Business models. Reducing complexity in our replication process, aligning to lead country pricing to distribution and supports bundles for Enterprise product, using Channel Factory model Finance has approved and HPE will pay DMI on One Path Business models for Global Inbound deals US Regional Deals for a Global Account are in scope for One Path (Benefits + new Channel Stock/Channel Factory business models
section.related-content:
We are breaking global into 3 categories: business as usual as it is today…no change no solution/segment benefits
Global inbound: we will be using one path factory/stock deals…..however there will be no benefits this should simplify the replication of creating the deals
Global account: could be outbound but have a local regional deal…..us regional deal we will use the one path terms and benefits can be approved

section.title: What are the E2E changes for Business Model impact?
section.content: What are the E2E changes for Business Model impact? Internal Use Only Pricing to End User PDO creates ONE VBD; runs PROS if they can approve, release or sends to BDM if needed One deal BDM reviews PDO note for price PBM/Sales/Partner heavily engaged to drive pricing to meet requested end user price point Pricing to distribution (we will no longer set end user price) Multiple Deals, for same opportunity Multiple Deals, PDO complete NEW channel factory template: “linking all deals” for same opportunity LEAD partner receives most aggressive pricing ; non-LEAD partner deals will receive Typical level pricing LEAD Partner = Partner approved for benefits. HPE will look to meet requested price and escalate deal Non-LEAD Partner = HPE will provide Typical Pricing and will not escalate pricing FROM Value Indirect TO Channel Factory What are the E2E changes for Business Model impact? HPE will look to meet requested price and escalate deal Non-LEAD Partner = HPE will provide Typical Pricing and will not escalate pricing FROM Value Indirect TO Channel Factory
section.related-content:
Key point – BDMs will have to read the template and understanding who’s the Lead / non Lead partner, the various benefits and the various deals.
Lead partner is the partner holding benefits. Non Lead partner will not have benefits.
We know that Sales, PBM’s and partners may request more aggressive pricing than Typical level. We’ll discuss this in a few slides.

section.title: New Channel Factory Template
section.content: New Channel Factory Template There are 2 available Factory Templates: Factory Ind Lead Partner Note Factory Ind Non-Lead Partner PDO will complete the Factory Template with key pieces of information linking the Lead Partner and Non-Lead partner information together Select Comment Type Select Standard Terms & Conditions Select item that corresponds with the Comment Type BDM’s will be responsible for reviewing the details before they proceed with Deal Authorization New Channel Factory Template There are 2 available Factory Templates: Factory Ind Lead Partner Note Factory Ind Non-Lead Partner PDO will complete the Factory Template with key pieces of information linking the Lead Partner and Non-Lead partner information together Select Comment Type Select Standard Terms & Conditions Select item that corresponds with the Comment Type BDM’s will be responsible for reviewing the details before they proceed with Deal Authorization

section.title: Channel Factory Summary
section.content: Channel Factory Summary Multiple deals for same opportunity BDM will only approve Lead Partner Channel Factory big deal. All non-lead Partner requests for Special Pricing will be priced at ‘Typical’ by PDO and PDO will advise that this is the ‘best available’ All Value registrations and Value Big Deals will remain valid through the original expiration date Once expired process will follow new Program Structure Partner can elect to migrate to new program (before expiration), but legacy registration/deal will need to be expired BDM will evaluate non-Lead deals when the account team requests pricing below Typical (you will follow the new escalation process for these opportunities.) Channel Factory Summary Multiple deals for same opportunity BDM will only approve Lead Partner Channel Factory big deal. All non-lead Partner requests for Special Pricing will be priced at ‘Typical’ by PDO and PDO will advise that this is the ‘best available’ All Value registrations and Value Big Deals will remain valid through the original expiration date Once expired process will follow new Program Structure Partner can elect to migrate to new program (before expiration), but legacy registration/deal will need to be expired BDM will evaluate non-Lead deals when the account team requests pricing below Typical (you will follow the new escalation process for these opportunities.)

section.related-content:
No touch/Low touch pricing can be received by any partner, however only the Lead partner gets the benefits. (Solution/Segment)
As you can see, only the lead partner receives special pricing and only the lead partner gets benefits. In this example the lead partner has more aggressive BD pricing: $10K ($70,000-$60,000) lower than the Non-Lead partner for same config (as Non-Lead partners are approved at Typical level), plus Lead partner gets $7,800 ($5,400+$2,400) in solution and segment benefit. It’s up to the lead partner whether or not they contribute any of their benefits to hitting the end user price. In total, Lead partner has better pricing by $17,500. ($70,000-52,200)
Let’s Assume the scenario where Non-Lead partner comes with different config, in this example they get special pricing at $85K (Typical level) and there are no benefits. The difference in BD pricing between Lead and Non-Lead in this example is $25,000 and considering the benefits it’s $32,500.
The delta between the lead partner and Non-Lead partner BD special pricing ($60,000 vs. $85,000) may cause escalation to the BDM to bring Non-Lead partner pricing closer to lead partner pricing. Use defined escalation process when/if this arises.

section.title: Channel Factory – Non-Lead Partner Escalation
section.content: Channel Factory – Non-Lead Partner Escalation Internal Use Only Partner submits request to PDO for deeper discountPDO responds back to Partner advising that it was ‘Best Price’ for Non-Lead Partner PDO/Sales sends escalation to BDMBDM reviews price request and may discuss with SalesBDM uses judgement to price deal (but will not approve discount same/better than Lead PartnerBDM responds with Best & Final BDM Updates Tracker 1 2 PDO has responded with Typical for Non-Lead Partner Channel Factory – Non-Lead Partner Escalation Internal Use Only Partner submits request to PDO for deeper discountPDO responds back to Partner advising that it was ‘Best Price’ for Non-Lead Partner PDO/Sales sends escalation to BDMBDM reviews price request and may discuss with SalesBDM uses judgement to price deal (but will not approve discount same/better than Lead PartnerBDM responds with Best & Final BDM Updates Tracker 1 2 PDO has responded with Typical for Non-Lead Partner
section.related-content:
Tracker will be used for first 60 days – line of sight to number of escalations will help us determine if a process change is needed. Currently we are not sure how often this will happen and we may need to adjust how often the spreadsheet will need to be updated. We will be tracking this weekly as the BDM that will be available on the SharePoint
For BDM judgement we need to evaluate both the opportunities to make sure the non lead does not get more discounting than the lead.
Request may come from the PBM asking for better pricing, leading to channel conflict, and we need to have sales team confirm that they approve to give better than Typical pricing.

section.title: What are the E2E changes for Business Model impact?
section.content: What are the E2E changes for Business Model impact? Internal Use Only Pricing to Distribution PDO GBS creates deal; runs PROS for approval, sends to BDM if unable to approve all pricing All partners are listed on the deal. BDM reviews PDO comments for pricing request. Pricing to Distribution PDO creates deal, imports Discount Now %’s for price compare, and completes Channel Stock template and submits to BDM; BDM will review pricing and compare to Discount Now %’s. *One Deal* BDM review NEW Channel Stock template, compare AUTH pricing to Discount Now % and an escalation is only completed if the LEAD partner requests LEAD Partner = Partner approved for benefits. HPE will look to meet requested price and escalate deal Non-LEAD Partner = Will receive same pricing as Lead Partner – but is not eligible for deeper discount FROM Indirect/Partner Direct TO Channel Stock What are the E2E changes for Business Model impact? Internal Use Only Pricing to Distribution PDO GBS creates deal; runs PROS for approval, sends to BDM if unable to approve all pricing All partners are listed on the deal. BDM reviews PDO comments for pricing request. Pricing to Distribution PDO creates deal, imports Discount Now %’s for price compare, and completes Channel Stock template and submits to BDM; BDM will review pricing and compare to Discount Now %’s. *One Deal* BDM review NEW Channel Stock template, compare AUTH pricing to Discount Now % and an escalation is only completed if the LEAD partner requests LEAD Partner = Partner approved for benefits. HPE will look to meet requested price and escalate deal Non-LEAD Partner = Will receive same pricing as Lead Partner – but is not eligible for deeper discount FROM Indirect/Partner Direct TO Channel Stock

section.title: New Channel Stock Template
section.content: New Channel Stock Template There is 1 available Stock Templates: Stock Indirect Note PDO will complete the Stock Template with key pieces of information linking the Lead Partner and Non-Lead partner information together Select Comment Type Select Standard Terms & Conditions Select item that corresponds with the Comment Type BDM’s will be responsible for reviewing the details before they proceed with Deal Authorization New Channel Stock Template There is 1 available Stock Templates: Stock Indirect Note PDO will complete the Stock Template with key pieces of information linking the Lead Partner and Non-Lead partner information together Select Comment Type Select Standard Terms & Conditions Select item that corresponds with the Comment Type BDM’s will be responsible for reviewing the details before they proceed with Deal Authorization

section.title: Stock Deals/Discount Now % compare to Auth Addl%
section.content: Stock Deals/Discount Now % compare to Auth Addl% All Stock Deals will be routed to Sales Development BDM Guidelines BDM’s will now compare Discount Now % to Auth Addl%. BDM’s will approve with PROS for all lines that are ‘Above Floor’ and AUTH those lines ‘Below Floor’. Compare the Discount Now % to the Auth Addl %. If the Auth Addl % is the same/better than Discount Now% and ‘Above Floor’, no action needed. If the Auth Addl % is ‘Below Floor’ and more aggressive than Discount Now %, clear authorization and escalate to Finance. If the Auth Addl % is lower than Discount Now %, clear authorization, and adjust to match Discount Now % (even if below floor). Re-approve using Guidance Based Auth (GBA). This activity will be treated as ‘best effort’ by BDM If Partners receive Discount Now price after requesting Special Pricing – they will be instructed to use Discount Now and not revisit the Special pricing process Internal Use Only Stock Deals/Discount Now % compare to Auth Addl% All Stock Deals will be routed to Sales Development BDM Guidelines BDM’s will now compare Discount Now % to Auth Addl%. BDM’s will approve with PROS for all lines that are ‘Above Floor’ and AUTH those lines ‘Below Floor’. Compare the Discount Now % to the Auth Addl %. If the Auth Addl % is the same/better than Discount Now% and ‘Above Floor’, no action needed. If the Auth Addl % is ‘Below Floor’ and more aggressive than Discount Now %, clear authorization and escalate to Finance. If the Auth Addl % is lower than Discount Now %, clear authorization, and adjust to match Discount Now % (even if below floor). Re-approve using Guidance Based Auth (GBA). This activity will be treated as ‘best effort’ by BDM If Partners receive Discount Now price after requesting Special Pricing – they will be instructed to use Discount Now and not revisit the Special pricing process Internal Use Only

section.title: Channel Stock Summary
section.content: Channel Stock Summary Channel Stock deals can have multiple Lead/Non-Lead partners. PL/PF and PN pricing can not be combined on same deal when using Stock business model. HPE will attempt to provide same or better than Discount Now % - when Special Pricing is requested at a line item level All Volume registrations and Volume Big Deals will remain valid through the original expiration date. Once expired process will follow new program structure Partner can elect to migrate to new program (before expiration), except if there are multiple resellers named on a Volume Deal. Once deal expires, then it will move to new Channel Stock. Channel Stock Summary Channel Stock deals can have multiple Lead/Non-Lead partners. Once expired process will follow new program structure Partner can elect to migrate to new program (before expiration), except if there are multiple resellers named on a Volume Deal. Once deal expires, then it will move to new Channel Stock.

No touch/Low touch pricing can be received by any partner, however the Lead partner gets the benefit. (Solution/Segment)
As you can see, if the lead partner requests special pricing, both the lead partner and the non-lead partner receive the SAME special pricing as it’s on the same deal. The benefits of the lead partner of $7,800 ($5400+$2400) provides the pricing advantage to the lead partner.

section.title: Selling Motion Changes in DART
section.content: Selling Motion Changes in DART Selling Motion Changes in DART
section.related-content:
Now lets get into what we are familiar with DART
Today when we escalate for Value Indirect deal and we take it into dart the selling motion will show Corp Reseller.
- When escalating both Channel Factory and Channel Stock deals, the BDM must select the selling motion from the dropdown based on the benefits the LEAD partner qualifies for. Remember, you can only escalate pricing to finance for requests made by the lead partner. Non-Lead partners can not receive finance escalated pricing.
I am now going to make a point of reference to a new benefit that I have not previously mentioned. Cloud Builder: while it may be a new term to most BDM’s it is not a new benefit Historically, it is used less than 1% of all deals approved and we are not familiar with it. However, it is being transferred from our old benefits to One Path. You might not ever see this benefit but keep in mind that it is an eligible benefit and careful when selecting the selling motion in DART.

section.title: Selling Motions Answer Key
section.content: Selling Motions Answer Key Selling Motions Answer Key
section.related-content:
The PDO team will specify the exact benefit in their comments and we will have to select that through DART. So we had to shorten the benefit names to fit into dart so we created a key to keep us honest.
Also note there are multiple avenues the lead partner can qualify for.
Remember Solution benefits differ between Platinum and Non-Platinum partners. Segment benefit has no differentiation. This menu represents 2 scenarios for the benefits...Platinum and Non-Platinum. If this is a platinum partner, you will need to ensure that you select "platsol" in your benefit dropdown options.

section.content: One Path iComp Template Route to Market Terms have changed. SCREEN SHOTS OF iComp One Path iComp Template Route to Market Terms have changed. SCREEN SHOTS OF iComp
section.related-content:
We have a few changes to iComp. Where you are familiar with seeing Net Price to the Customer we have changed that to Big Deal net price…..again all pricing is to disty.
We changed sales incentives % and $ to Channel Benefits % and $.
Here at the bottom where you see the 3 arrows we have replaced the value indirect tab with One Path. It makes no difference if is it factory or stock you will past the financials under One Path. Direct stays the same. And Others will be for opportunities that have the One Path RTM but do not hold benefits.
The reality is….we will have 2 iComps……this one that you see here and our old one for Value and Volume Indirect deals.

section.related-content:
The changes to note in the iDev will be the new drop down in the parameter tab that allows you to select the applicable benefit to factor in when running financials. So if they are a platinum solution and segment partner you use the drop down and select Yes. Make sure the others have NA.
Now lets move our eyes down a bit to the Executive tab and we have changed the term to channel benefit where previously it showed SSR and NBO.

section.title: How to achieve same net price in new deal compared to legacy
section.content: How to achieve same net price in new deal compared to legacy Goal is to achieve same net price with benefits (if applicable) PDO Process PDO will add notes advising BDM that price parity from old deal to new deal is required Deals fitting the above criteria - will be routed to the BDM PDO will need to follow One Path process guidelines, if price parity not requested and/or no pre-knowledge of the requirement BDM Process BDM’s will leverage the Channel Stock or Channel Factory Cheat Sheets to establish pricing parity with One Path business model Internal Use Only Benefits Price Benefits Price BDM Business Rules If legacy deal has been escalated to Finance and has not expired (within 14 month life of deal) – BDM’s can approve without re-escalation If legacy deal has been escalated to Finance and has expired (after 14 month life of deal) – BDM’s must create new escalation How to achieve same net price in new deal compared to legacy Goal is to achieve same net price with benefits (if applicable) PDO Process PDO will add notes advising BDM that price parity from old deal to new deal is required Deals fitting the above criteria - will be routed to the BDM PDO will need to follow One Path process guidelines, if price parity not requested and/or no pre-knowledge of the requirement BDM Process BDM’s will leverage the Channel Stock or Channel Factory Cheat Sheets to establish pricing parity with One Path business model Internal Use Only Benefits Price Benefits Price BDM Business Rules If legacy deal has been escalated to Finance and has not expired (within 14 month life of deal) – BDM’s can approve without re-escalation If legacy deal has been escalated to Finance and has expired (after 14 month life of deal) – BDM’s must create new escalation

section.title: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet
section.content: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet Process Steps Open existing big deal. If expired, revise case, extend the END date of the deal. Also, enter qty 1 in the current month of the Rollout on the Product page. Take config to DART ensuring that “Corp Reseller” is selected as the Selling Motion and Sales Incentives is set to “Yes”. On Analysis Page, highlight the analysis including the word “Pricing”. Press CTRL C to copy the analysis. How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet Process Steps Open existing big deal. If expired, revise case, extend the END date of the deal. Also, enter qty 1 in the current month of the Rollout on the Product page. Take config to DART ensuring that “Corp Reseller” is selected as the Selling Motion and Sales Incentives is set to “Yes”. On Analysis Page, highlight the analysis including the word “Pricing”. Press CTRL C to copy the analysis.

section.title: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Paste (CTRL V) this analysis into the “Val Ind” tab. For the Summary page to work properly, the analysis must be copied & pasted as depicted. How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Paste (CTRL V) this analysis into the “Val Ind” tab. For the Summary page to work properly, the analysis must be copied & pasted as depicted.

section.title: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Now go back to your analysis in DART. Go to Deal Summary. Change the Selling Motion from “Corp Reseller” to the appropriate OnePath Selling Motion from the drop down box. The Selling Motion should match the Partner tier (Platinum or Non Platinum) and the approved One Path benefits. This information can be found in the “Factory Ind Lead Partner” template which was completed by PDO and added on the Comments tab in the Factory Deal. You will need press the “Calculate” button so that the new benefits are calculated. How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Now go back to your analysis in DART. Go to Deal Summary. Change the Selling Motion from “Corp Reseller” to the appropriate OnePath Selling Motion from the drop down box. The Selling Motion should match the Partner tier (Platinum or Non Platinum) and the approved One Path benefits. This information can be found in the “Factory Ind Lead Partner” template which was completed by PDO and added on the Comments tab in the Factory Deal. You will need press the “Calculate” button so that the new benefits are calculated.

section.title: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Go to Analysis Page. You will notice that the Net Revenue $ amount and the Sales Incentive % have changed. Highlight the analysis including the word “Pricing”. Press CTRL C to copy the analysis. How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Go to Analysis Page. You will notice that the Net Revenue $ amount and the Sales Incentive % have changed. Highlight the analysis including the word “Pricing”. Press CTRL C to copy the analysis.

section.title: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps In the iComp Factory cheat sheet, paste (CTRL V) this new analysis into the “DART Factory benefit %” tab. For the Summary page to work properly, the analysis must be copied & pasted as depicted. How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps In the iComp Factory cheat sheet, paste (CTRL V) this new analysis into the “DART Factory benefit %” tab. For the Summary page to work properly, the analysis must be copied & pasted as depicted.

section.title: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps On the Summary page, select “Y” from the Drop Down box on line 19 if there was NBO approved on the original big deal. If no NBO approved on original deal, leave as “N”. Do not select B/E Comp on the Summary page. Leave as “N”. The Net Rev (Disty Cost) Val Indirect, the Upfront Factory channel benefit % and Revised BD Net- Factory fields will be auto-populated. The Revised BD Net – Factory price is what you will to enter as the Auth Amt for the config in the New Factory big deal. How to populate Channel Factory cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps On the Summary page, select “Y” from the Drop Down box on line 19 if there was NBO approved on the original big deal. If no NBO approved on original deal, leave as “N”. Do not select B/E Comp on the Summary page. Leave as “N”. The Net Rev (Disty Cost) Val Indirect, the Upfront Factory channel benefit % and Revised BD Net- Factory fields will be auto-populated. The Revised BD Net – Factory price is what you will to enter as the Auth Amt for the config in the New Factory big deal.

section.title: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet
section.content: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet Process Steps Open existing/expired deal. Click on Products tab. Highlight line 1 of products and then press CTRL A. This will highlight all products. Press CTRL C to copy. How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet Process Steps Open existing/expired deal. Click on Products tab. Highlight line 1 of products and then press CTRL A. This will highlight all products. Press CTRL C to copy.

section.title: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Open a new excel spreadsheet and in cell A1, press CTRL V. This will paste the deal export. Perform a Sort by “Line Type” as you will only want “PN”. Delete all other Line Types. Delete all columns except Product Number, PL and Auth BDNet. How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Open a new excel spreadsheet and in cell A1, press CTRL V. This will paste the deal export. Perform a Sort by “Line Type” as you will only want “PN”. Delete all other Line Types. Delete all columns except Product Number, PL and Auth BDNet.

section.title: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps In the condensed deal export spreadsheet, delete the column headings in line 1 Click in cell A1 of the deal output, press CTRL A to highlight all 3 columns. Press CTRL C to copy. In the new Channel Stock cheat sheet, paste as Values in column C. . How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps In the condensed deal export spreadsheet, delete the column headings in line 1 Click in cell A1 of the deal output, press CTRL A to highlight all 3 columns. Press CTRL C to copy. In the new Channel Stock cheat sheet, paste as Values in column C. .

section.title: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps The NBO, SSR, Solution Benefit and Segment Benefit columns are pre-populated. If these columns do not match your original Eclipse deal, select the appropriate answer from the drop down box. Instructions can also be found in the Channel Stock cheat sheet. Based on the information input, you now have the Revised BD Net (column P) to enter into the new Stock deal. How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps The NBO, SSR, Solution Benefit and Segment Benefit columns are pre-populated. If these columns do not match your original Eclipse deal, select the appropriate answer from the drop down box. Instructions can also be found in the Channel Stock cheat sheet. Based on the information input, you now have the Revised BD Net (column P) to enter into the new Stock deal.

section.title: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Open new Channel Stock deal. Click on Products tab Highlight line 1 of products and then press CTRL A. This will highlight all products Press CTRL C to copy How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Open new Channel Stock deal. Click on Products tab Highlight line 1 of products and then press CTRL A. This will highlight all products Press CTRL C to copy

section.title: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Open a new excel spreadsheet and in cell A1, press CTRL V. This will paste the deal export. Delete all columns except Product Number, Description and Qty. How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Open a new excel spreadsheet and in cell A1, press CTRL V. This will paste the deal export. Delete all columns except Product Number, Description and Qty.

section.title: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d
section.content: How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Now perform a VLOOKUP against the Channel Stock cheat sheet. Once you have the Revised BD Net for each part number, you are ready to upload the products, quantities and BD Net price into the new Channel Stock deal. How to populate Channel Stock cheat sheet – cont’d Process Steps Now perform a VLOOKUP against the Channel Stock cheat sheet. Once you have the Revised BD Net for each part number, you are ready to upload the products, quantities and BD Net price into the new Channel Stock deal.

section.title: Identifying Deals that have HPE Negotiated Price Agreement
section.content: Identifying Deals that have HPE Negotiated Price Agreement PDO Process Deal Creator will check for the flag and if selected - will know that these deals are out of scope for One Path If new request and no indication of contractual pricing agreement - PDO will follow One Path rules If deal is later identified as HPE Negotiated Price Agreement - no benefits will be approved after initial 6 months Note: When a deal expires and copy is required - PDO will check prior deal for the flag BDM Process BDM will need to check the flag for deals that meet the criteria (customers with contractual/pricing agreement obligation) If BDM has existing HPE Negotiated Price Agreements (i.e. Intel, GE) when those deals expire, the new deal will be created in the volume Indirect business model Internal Use Only Custom Option is now available in Eclipse to identify those ‘exception’ deals, where we have a contractual/pricing agreement obligation with certain customers Identifying Deals that have HPE Negotiated Price Agreement PDO Process Deal Creator will check for the flag and if selected - will know that these deals are out of scope for One Path If new request and no indication of contractual pricing agreement - PDO will follow One Path rules If deal is later identified as HPE Negotiated Price Agreement - no benefits will be approved after initial 6 months Note: When a deal expires and copy is required - PDO will check prior deal for the flag BDM Process BDM will need to check the flag for deals that meet the criteria (customers with contractual/pricing agreement obligation) If BDM has existing HPE Negotiated Price Agreements (i.e. Intel, GE) when those deals expire, the new deal will be created in the volume Indirect business model Internal Use Only Custom Option is now available in Eclipse to identify those ‘exception’ deals, where we have a contractual/pricing agreement obligation with certain customers

section.title: Process Guidelines
section.content: Process Guidelines FrameworkIf a BTO Framework is needed for your customer, it must be on a Indirect/Partner Dir deal (it can not go on a Channel Stock Deal). If a BTO Frameworks is required, Sales Development must contact the PDO Exceptions Team (Non-Standard Deals) E-Rate and SLED/FED Frameworks are excluded and can be supported on a ‘Channel Stock Tier’ dealPublic SectorIf Sales want multiple partners to bid – they must not approve benefits (Factory Only)Software (Data Protector)As-is process for Sales Dev. /HW is governed by PROS & SW will follow paper guidelines Internal Use Only Process Guidelines FrameworkIf a BTO Framework is needed for your customer, it must be on a Indirect/Partner Dir deal (it can not go on a Channel Stock Deal). If a BTO Frameworks is required, Sales Development must contact the PDO Exceptions Team (Non-Standard Deals) E-Rate and SLED/FED Frameworks are excluded and can be supported on a ‘Channel Stock Tier’ dealPublic SectorIf Sales want multiple partners to bid – they must not approve benefits (Factory Only)Software (Data Protector)As-is process for Sales Dev. /HW is governed by PROS & SW will follow paper guidelines Internal Use Only

section.title: Channel Stock – Discount Now
section.content: Channel Stock – Discount Now PDO has been tasked with loading Discount Now % in Eclipse Deal and if it’s not loaded you should request PDO to update. If timing is critical, BDM’s can follow the steps to load the Discount Now %, if required 1 2 Deal Tab: Click the “Use Predefined Pricing” Field marked “Available” 3 Deal Tab: Select the One Path Pricing pricing source. 4 Products Tab: Ensure you can see the Predef Disc % Column  Select All Rows Products Tab: Right Click  Click Load Predefined Pricing Channel Stock – Discount Now PDO has been tasked with loading Discount Now % in Eclipse Deal and if it’s not loaded you should request PDO to update. If timing is critical, BDM’s can follow the steps to load the Discount Now %, if required 1 2 Deal Tab: Click the “Use Predefined Pricing” Field marked “Available” 3 Deal Tab: Select the One Path Pricing pricing source. 4 Products Tab: Ensure you can see the Predef Disc % Column  Select All Rows Products Tab: Right Click  Click Load Predefined Pricing
